      Attach a method to a POST request at a path.

      Figure out what kind of HTTPHandler you want, based on the path.
      void HTTPRequest.parseRequest()
      Kicks off the request's parsing.
      HTTPHandler HTTPRouter.route(java.lang.String pathSegment, HTTPRequest request)
      Route determines which HTTPHandler to use based on the first path segment (between the first and second `/`).
      void HTTPRequest.setRequestLine(java.lang.String line)
      Sets the requestLine, and all derived items.
      Constructors in httpserver that throw HTTPException 
      Constructor and Description
      HTTPHandler()
      Create an HTTPHandler.
      HTTPRequest(java.net.Socket connection)
      Used to parse out an HTTP request provided a Socket and figure out the handler to be used.
      MessageHandler(int code, java.lang.String message)
      Create a message handler All it does is call message(code, message).
      MessageHandler(java.lang.String message)
      Create a message handler, with the HTTP status set to 200 Calls message(200, message).
